title: Intensive Course on Scientific Software Development for Nursing Continuing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy, foundational nursing knowledge, elementary understanding of scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis formulation, experimental design)
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education combining software development processes with nursing content via a contextual instructional design-based LMS. Special focus is placed on developing educational content applying scientific methodologies such as medical data measurement, analysis, and visualization.

learning_goals: Learners can write a software functional specification reflecting scientific needs for nursing continuing education.
Learners can implement a prototype processing experimental/observational data for nursing education content by applying an LMS-based development process.

Learners can complete a software development project in teams of three within five days using collaborative tools like GitHub and Trello in a BYOD environment, achieving over 80% implementation of functional requirements and scoring 3+ out of 5 on a peer evaluation rubric. This process applies scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis setting, variable control, data analysis, conclusion drawing).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
